text:
In this video, you’ll see how to manage launch settings 
with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery (AWS DRS).

With this solution, you can configure 
default launch settings and default

Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud 
(Amazon EC2) launch templates,

as well as perform bulk changes to the 
launch configurations on existing source servers.

We’ll begin in the AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery Console, 
where we’ll navigate to the default launch settings.

Launch settings control how drill, recovery, 
and failback instances will be launched in AWS.

Let’s quickly look at how to edit 
the default DRS launch settings.

The launch settings configured here will be 
applied to every newly added source server.
Next, let’s edit the EC2 launch template.

We’ll configure the advanced settings, to automatically 
assign a public IP to newly launched instances.

These settings will only be applied 
to newly added source servers.

EC2 launch templates for existing source
 servers need to be edited from the Source
servers page, which we'll look at in a moment.
Let’s save the launch template.

All future source servers will now 
launch with a public IP by default.

Next, let’s configure the existing source 
servers to use the same launch settings.

We can select multiple source servers and 
use the Actions dropdown to make bulk updates.

We’ll edit the EC2 launch template to match 
the default configuration we set up earlier.
Now let’s confirm the changes took effect.

Auto assign public IP is set to Yes for this source server, 
confirming the launch settings have been updated.

You’ve just seen how to manage launch
settings with AWS Elastic Disaster Recovery.

You can learn more about this topic in 
the description and links for this video.
Thanks for watching. Now it’s your turn to try.
